title: [BUG] Keras in docker gives issue: Tensor is not an element of this graph.
body:
Thank you for submitting an issue. Please refer to our [issue policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md)
for information on what types of issues we address. For help with debugging your code, please refer to [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/mlflow).

Please fill in this template and do not delete it unless you are sure your issue is outside its scope.

### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: Yes
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: 16.04 (in docker aswell)
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**:  source (pip install)
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**:1.3.0 (docker aswell)
- **Python version**: 3.6.9
- **npm version, if running the dev UI**:
- **Exact command to reproduce**:

See https://github.com/ssYkse/mlflowworkshop.
(sorry, its german, i'll give details below how to reproduce)

### Describe the problem
Describe the problem clearly here. Include descriptions of the expected behavior and the actual behavior.

I have created a mlflow.keras model (see train.py), which I wraped inside a pyfunc model (package_model.py) to be able to add the preprocessing to the inference.

I dockerize this model with mlflow build-docker ..., and serve the model.
When sending a Post request to this docker server, i get the following response (edited for legibility):
```
curl -d "@exampjson" -H 'Content-Type: application/json-numpy-split' -X POST localhost:5001/invocations{"error_code": "BAD_REQUEST", "message": "Encountered an unexpected error while evaluating the model. Verify that the serialized input Dataframe is compatible with the model for inference.", "stack_trace": "Traceback (most recent call last):
  File \"/miniconda/envs/custom_env/lib/python3.6/site-packages/mlflow/pyfunc/scoring_server/__init__.py\", line 196, in transformation
    raw_predictions = model.predict(data)
  File \"/miniconda/envs/custom_env/lib/python3.6/site-packages/mlflow/pyfunc/model.py\", line 243, in predict
    return self.python_model.predict(self.context, model_input)
  File \"package_model.py\", line 54, in predict
  File \"/miniconda/envs/custom_env/lib/python3.6/site-packages/keras/engine/sequential.py\", line 268, in predict_classes
    proba = self.predict(x, batch_size=batch_size, verbose=verbose)
  File \"/miniconda/envs/custom_env/lib/python3.6/site-packages/keras/engine/training.py\", line 1456, in predict
    self._make_predict_function()
  File \"/miniconda/envs/custom_env/lib/python3.6/site-packages/keras/engine/training.py\", line 378, in _make_predict_function
    **kwargs)
  File \"/miniconda/envs/custom_env/lib/python3.6/site-packages/keras/backend/tensorflow_backend.py\", line 3009, in function
    **kwargs)
  File \"/miniconda/envs/custom_env/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/backend.py\", line 3479, in function
    return GraphExecutionFunction(inputs, outputs, updates=updates, **kwargs)
  File \"/miniconda/envs/custom_env/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/keras/backend.py\", line 3142, in __init__
    with ops.control_dependencies([self.outputs[0]]):
  File \"/miniconda/envs/custom_env/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/framework/ops.py\", line 5426, in control_dependencies
    return get_default_graph().control_dependencies(control_inputs)
  File \"/miniconda/envs/custom_env/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/framework/ops.py\", line 4867, in control_dependencies
    c = self.as_graph_element(c)
  File \"/miniconda/envs/custom_env/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/framework/ops.py\", line 3796, in as_graph_element
    return self._as_graph_element_locked(obj, allow_tensor, allow_operation)
  File \"/miniconda/envs/custom_env/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/framework/ops.py\", line 3875, in _as_graph_element_locked
    raise ValueError(\"Tensor %s is not an element of this graph.\" % obj)
ValueError: Tensor Tensor(\"dense2/Softmax:0\", shape=(?, 10), dtype=float32) is not an element of this graph.
"}
```

### Code to reproduce issue
Provide a reproducible test case that is the bare minimum necessary to generate the problem.

clone the repo https://github.com/ssYkse/mlflowworkshop and cd into it
run the following commands, where you replace ...id... with the correct mlflow run id:

    mkdir ./data
    mlflow run ./ -e get_data
    mlflow run ./ -e preprocess
    mlflow run ./ -e train-fast -P input_dir=./mlruns/0/....id-previous-run..../artifacts
    mlflow run ./ -e package -P model_dir=./mlruns/0/....id-previous-run.../artifacts/myModel
  
when I now run

    mlflow models serve -m ./model
    curl -d "@example.json" -h 'Content-Type: application/json-numpy-split' localhost:5000/invocations

It works. However, when I package this as a docker image

    mlflow models build-docker -m ./model -n "my-image"
    docker run -p 5001:8080 "my-image"
   
in second terminal, same working dir:
     curl -d "@example.json" -h 'Content-Type: application/json-numpy-split' localhost:5001/invocations

I get the issue, mentioned above.

### Other info / logs
Include any logs or source code that would be helpful to diagnose the problem. If including tracebacks,
please include the full traceback. Large logs and files should be attached.
